Submodules¶

microtool.acquisition_scheme module¶

class microtool.acquisition_scheme.AcquisitionParameters(values: ndarray, unit: str, scale: float, symbol: str | None = None, lower_bound: float | None = 0.0, upper_bound: float | None = None, fixed: bool = False)¶

Bases: object

Defines a series of N MR acquisition parameter values, such as a series of b-values.

Parameters:

  • values – A numpy array with N parameter values.

  • unit – The parameter unit as a string, e.g. ‘s/mm²’.s

  • scale – The typical parameter value scale (order of magnitude).

  • symbol – A string used in type setting

  • lower_bound – Lower constraint. None is used to specify no bound. Default: 0.

  • upper_bound – Upper constraint. None is used to specify no bound. Default: None.

  • fixed – Boolean indicating if the parameter is considered fixed or not (default: false).

property free_values: ndarray¶
property optimize_mask¶
set_fixed_mask(fixed_mask: ndarray) → None¶

Set the measurements you wish to stay fixed during optimization of this parameter.

Parameters:

fixed_mask – The boolean np.array that evaluates True for values that need to stay fixed

set_free_values(new_values: ndarray) → None¶

Change the value of only the parameter values that should be optimised

Parameters:

new_values – The values to be assigned

class microtool.acquisition_scheme.AcquisitionScheme(parameters: Dict[str, AcquisitionParameters])¶

Bases: Dict[str, AcquisitionParameters], ABC

Base-class for MR acquisition schemes.

Parameters:

parameters – A dictionary with AcquisitionParameters. Try to stick to BIDS nomenclature for the parameter keys.

Raises:

ValueError – Lists have unequal length.

abstract property constraints: List[LinearConstraint | NonlinearConstraint] | LinearConstraint | NonlinearConstraint¶

Returns optimisation constraints on the scheme parameters. Implementation is child-class specific.

Returns:

A scipy.optimize.LinearConstraint object. None is used to specify no constraints.

The constraint is defined by lb <= A.x <= ub, x being the array of parameters optimized. A is the matrix defining the constraint relation between parameters.

property free_parameter_bounds_scaled: List[Tuple[float | None, ...]]¶
Returns:

The free parameters bounds divided by their scales. List of min max pairs

property free_parameter_keys: List[str]¶

Function for extracting the keys of the free parameters

Returns:

list of the keys of the free parameters, in the same order as free_parameters

property free_parameter_scales: ndarray¶

Getter for the scale of the free parameters repeated for the number of pulses.

Returns:

The scale of the free parameters

property free_parameter_vector: ndarray¶

Returns all the free parameters as a flattened vector. :return:

property free_parameters: Dict[str, ndarray]¶

Returns the free acquisition parameters as a dictionary of AcquisitionParameter name : values

Returns:

A dictionary containing key : TissueParameter.values pairs.

get_free_parameter_idx(parameter: str, pulse_id: int) → int¶

Allows you to get the index in the free parameter vector of a parameter pulse number combination :param parameter: The name of free acquisition parameter :param pulse_id: The pulse for which you need the index :return: The index

get_parameter_from_parameter_vector(parameter: str, x: ndarray) → ndarray¶

This function helps to get a free parameter from a scipy array. Usefull for building constraints on specific parameters. Be warned the function does not check if the parameter you require is actually a free parameter!!

Parameters:

  • parameter – The name of the free parameter you wish to extract from the scipy array.

  • x – The scipy array of free parameters, in scaled units.

Returns:

The rescaled parameter values from the scipy array (so now in physical units).

property pulse_count: int¶
set_free_parameter_bounds(bounds: List[Tuple[float, float]]) → None¶

Setter function for the parameter bounds, requires you to provide bounds for all parameters in sequence :param bounds: The bounds :return: None, changes parameter attributes

set_free_parameter_vector(vector: ndarray) → None¶

A setter function for the free parameters. Infers the desired parameter by shape information :param vector: The parameter vector you wish to assign to the scheme :return: None, changes parameter attributes

class microtool.acquisition_scheme.DiffusionAcquisitionScheme(b_values: List[float] | ndarray, b_vectors: List[Tuple[float, float, float]] | ndarray, pulse_widths: List[float] | ndarray, pulse_intervals: List[float] | ndarray, echo_times: List[float] | ndarray | None = None, scan_parameters: ScannerParameters = ScannerParameters(t_90=4.0, t_180=6.0, t_half=14.0, G_max=0.2, S_max=1.3))¶

Bases: AcquisitionScheme

Defines a diffusion MR acquisition scheme. (PGSE?)

Parameters:

  • b_values – A list or numpy array of b-values in s/mm².

  • b_vectors – A list or numpy array of direction cosines.

  • pulse_widths – A list or numpy array of pulse widths δ in milliseconds.

  • pulse_intervals – A list or numpy array of pulse intervals Δ in milliseconds.

Raises:

ValueError – b-vectors are not unit vectors or lists have unequal length.

property b_values: ndarray¶

An array of N b-values in s/mm².

property b_vectors: ndarray¶

An N×3 array of direction cosines.

property constraints: NonlinearConstraint | List[NonlinearConstraint] | None¶

Returns optimisation constraints on the scheme parameters. Implementation is child-class specific.

Returns:

A scipy.optimize.LinearConstraint object. None is used to specify no constraints.

The constraint is defined by lb <= A.x <= ub, x being the array of parameters optimized. A is the matrix defining the constraint relation between parameters.

property echo_times: ndarray¶
property phi: ndarray¶

An array of N angles in radians.

property pulse_intervals: ndarray¶

An array of N pulse intervals in milliseconds.

property pulse_magnitude: ndarray¶
Returns:

An array of N gradient magnitudes in mT/m. Assumes b = γ² G² δ² (Δ - δ/3).

property pulse_widths: ndarray¶

An array of N pulse widths in milliseconds.

property theta: ndarray¶

An array of N angles in radians.

write_bval(file: str | bytes | PathLike) → None¶

Writes b-values to an FSL [*_]dwi.bval file.

write_bvec(file) → None¶

Writes b-vectors to an FSL [*_]dwi.bvec file.

Bases: AcquisitionScheme

Defines an inversion-recovery MR acquisition scheme.

Parameters:

  • repetition_times – A list or numpy array of repetition times TR in milliseconds.

  • echo_times – A list or numpy array of echo times TE in milliseconds.

  • inversion_times – A list or numpy array of inversion times TI in milliseconds.

Raises:

ValueError – Lists have unequal length.

Returns optimisation constraints on the scheme parameters. Implementation is child-class specific.

Returns:

A scipy.optimize.LinearConstraint object. None is used to specify no constraints.

The constraint is defined by lb <= A.x <= ub, x being the array of parameters optimized. A is the matrix defining the constraint relation between parameters.

property echo_times: ndarray¶

property inversion_times: ndarray¶

An array of N inversion times in milliseconds.

property repetition_times: ndarray¶

An array of N repetition times in milliseconds.

Wrapper for the MultiCompartment models used by dmipy. Note that the parameters need to be initialized in the dmipy model otherwise a value error is raised.

microtool.dmipy.convert_diffusion_scheme2dmipy_scheme(scheme: DiffusionAcquisitionScheme) → DmipyAcquisitionScheme¶

Takes in a scheme from the microtool toolbox and returns a scheme for the dmipy toolbox. It should be noted that the dmipy toolbox takes SI unit acquisition parameters only. Therefore we convert the microtool parameters. Additionally, this conversion loses the echo time information! This is due to the fact that dmipy has the notion that echo times are constrained to the same shell. We use a more relaxed approach.

Parameters:

scheme – DiffusionAcquisitionScheme

Returns:

DmipyAcquisitionScheme

microtool.dmipy.convert_dmipy_scheme2diffusion_scheme(scheme: DmipyAcquisitionScheme, scanner_parameters: ScannerParameters = ScannerParameters(t_90=4.0, t_180=6.0, t_half=14.0, G_max=0.2, S_max=1.3)) → DiffusionAcquisitionScheme¶

Takes a scheme from the dmipy toolbox and converts to scheme from microtool toolbox. We convert units since microtool has non SI units.

Parameters:

  • scheme – DmipyAcquisitionScheme

  • scanner_parameters – Scanner specific parameters

Returns:

DiffusionAcquisitionScheme

microtool.dmipy.get_parameters(multi_model: MultiCompartmentModel) → Dict[str, TissueParameter]¶

Compiles a dictionary of all tissue parameters present in the given multi-compartment model. These are wrapped in the microtool TissueParameter wrapper. Parameter linking and optimization flags are extracted.

Parameters:

multi_model – A dmipy multi-compartment model.

Returns:

A dictionary of tissueparameters

microtool.tissue_model module¶

The TissueModel is a base class for different kinds of tissue models (different types of models and/or different types

of modelling-software).

In order to simulate the MR signal in response to a MICROtool acquisition scheme, the TissueModel first translates the

acquisition scheme to a modelling-software specific one.

class microtool.tissue_model.RelaxationTissueModel(t1: float, t2: float, s0: float = 1.0)¶

Bases: TissueModel

Defines a tissue by its relaxation parameters.

Parameters:

  • t1 – Longitudinal relaxation time constant T1 in milliseconds.

  • t2 – Transverse relaxation time constant T2 in milliseconds.

  • s0 – MR signal from fully recovered magnetisation, just before the 90° RF pulse.

fit(scheme: InversionRecoveryAcquisitionScheme, signal: ndarray, **fit_options) → FittedModelCurveFit¶

Fits the tissue model parameters to noisy_signal data given an acquisition scheme. :param signal: The noisy signal :param scheme: The scheme under investigation :return: A FittedTissueModel

jacobian(scheme: InversionRecoveryAcquisitionScheme) → ndarray¶

Calculates the change in MR signal attenuation due to a change in the tissue model parameters.

The order of the tissue parameters is the same as returned by get_parameters().

Parameters:

scheme – An AcquisitionScheme.

Returns:

An N×M Jacobian matrix, where N is the number of samples and M is the number of tissue parameters.

class microtool.tissue_model.TissueModelDecorator(original: TissueModel)¶

Bases: TissueModel, ABC

Abstract class for initialization of TissueModel decorators. this just passes all public methods to the original object override these methods to extend or alter functionality while retaining the same interface.

This concept is based on the decorator design pattern and more information can be found at https://refactoring.guru/design-patterns/decorator

fit(scheme: AcquisitionScheme, signal: ndarray, **fit_options) → FittedModel¶

Fits the tissue model parameters to noisy_signal data given an acquisition scheme. :param signal: The noisy signal :param scheme: The scheme under investigation :return: A FittedTissueModel

class microtool.tissue_model.TissueParameter(value: float, scale: float, optimize: bool = True, fit_flag: bool = True, fit_bounds: tuple = (0.0, inf))¶

Bases: object

Defines a scalar tissue parameter and its properties.

Parameters:

  • value – Parameter value.

  • scale – The typical parameter value scale (order of magnitude).

  • optimize – Specifies if the parameter should be included in the optimization of an AcquisitionScheme. If we dont optimize the scheme we assume the parameter is known and exclude it from fitting as well.

  • fit_flag – Specifies if the parameter should be included in the fitting process.

  • fit_bounds – Specificies the domain in which to attempt the fitting of this parameter.

fit_bounds: tuple = (0.0, inf)¶
fit_flag: bool = True¶
optimize: bool = True¶
scale: float¶
value: float¶
